In conclusion, telomerase is involved in the maintenance of telomeres, which are repetitive nucleotide sequences at the end of chromosomes that are critical to the normal function of cells. Telomeres are usually protected from degradation by telomerase, a specialized enzyme that is produced by the cell to help repair and lengthen telomeres. When telomerase becomes overactive, or when it is in short supply, degradation of telomeres occurs, leading to cell death. In addition, prolonged periods of cell division may lead to degradation of telomeres, and eventually to cell death. This can explain why it is possible for a cell to become immortal through the use of telomerase.
